intro: Boehmeria dolichostachya, commonly known as the long-stalked nettle, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettle species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Boehmeria dolichostachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
